This Barolo will be great with more age. Great cherry, raspberries and Chocolate flavors, but even with a decanting the tannins were in control. Was great with a full fresh spaghetti, but after dinner the tannins were still over riding.  Serve with food!!!

Fine perfume of dark red berries, grilled herbs, plum, licorice, violet & earthy sottobosco lifts from the glass. Instantly sold on its indelible precision & underlying depth, although reticence appears to be the mood. Youthfully austere, brilliant innate energy & flavour intensity are all pent-up underneath the tightly-knit structure. Powers to a spicy, iron-inflected firm finish. Shutting down now but seriously tantalizing.

17/5/2

Garnet burgundy color, this is a more extracted and modern style, a masculine wine with power and grits, nose smells of licorice, black cherry, blackberry, cured meat, sandalwood, clove, nutmeg, coriander, hazelnut and leather, medium to full body, very firm tannin still, with balanced acidity, tastes of licorice, tar, mesquite wood, black cherry, India ink, quince paste and hibiscus, better to forget it for 5-8 years, nice finish with a Maraschino cherry aftertaste.

Least approachable of the 3 Vajra. Fruits dominated by a massive wall of tannins from fore to finish. Quite bitter. Wait.
Tons of potential, hidden beneath the tannic wall. Tobacco, pepper, bitter almond, leather, tar, and a sturdy layer of black berries canâ€™t wait to try again in a few years.
Bright ruby in colour. Maraschino cherry, raspberries, red currants, cranberries, leather, and oak in the aroma. Flavour of oak, leather, cranberries, red currants, and tobacco leaves. 89.

Decanted 1 1/2 hours (needed way more). Surprised at the power behind this very tasty Barolo. Loads of cherries and tar to start with but over time changed to a more cough syrup styled cherry note with a slight menthol note. Very tasty and needs moreover way more time to develop.  Refined but noticeable tannins. 
Look forward to trying it again in a few years time.

Complex notes of Amarena cherries, tobacco, tar, dried roses but all in a subtle and delicate balance. 
Monster high tannins with supportive acidity. Shows depth in palate and has a firm structure providing it with a long ageing potential.

This is similar to the Bricco delle Viole but more intense on the nose and emphasises the fruit core more.  That being said,  the tertiary notes are in abundance as is the structure.  Tasting this side by side, this was more appealing now at this early stage but I think this has the ability to age as well.  Apparently this is much kore limited in numbers so I've grabbed a few before they're gone.  Looking forward to following its evolution

Vibrantly spicy and fresh on the nose which carries through to the palate. Complex raspberry and summer fruits with initial high acidity giving way to savoury chewy tannins. It totally hits the spot. Terrific!
An strong prescience of oak providing a fine accompaniment to a Sunday roast.

100/100
Great Barolo!
Had this at the vineyard, just amazing!
Knocked me off my feet. A really wonderful experience, and you know it will be from sniff one.

A bigger, denser fruit core to the others tasted so far today. Sour cherries, with a hint of sweeter sasparilla as well. There is a hint of savoury spice, like Gloggi towards the end, and light but firm tannins. Really nicely put together. 4.1 from me. 2012 tasted 12/11/2016

4,15* cherry, black cherry, balsamic, some pine, some oak, light animalistic tone, lilac, violet, dried rose, strawberry.
Very juicy on the pallet. Sour cherry pie, rose. Lots of fruit. Powerful tannins. Very young. Long finish.

Objectivity this is a good wine, especially 24hr after the bottle was opened. However, for me, there is just too much oak presence. Presumably barriques were used. My issue is that I feel that the unique character is somewhat masked by the oak. I still get strawberry,  raisin and a bit of rose hip and lots of vanilla but the further nuances are under a shroud. The amount of oak is varying between bottles of the same vintage, which I canâ€™t really explain.

Good. Very good quality, juicy, quite rich wine. It still rather medium- high density (not too dense) structure, some green tanins still there (not too much, they gone after decanting). Black berries in taste and nose. Very tasty wine. At the same time have strong feeling that few more years would be great for this barolo.

Smoky, iron, gun powder, leather, beef, sweet cinnamon, licorice, plum, rose petal and raspberry. Less floral more fruity. Oak and tabacco as well. Full body, sweet, nice tannins, lovely fruit and good acidity. From the wines everybody will love.

A perfect Nebbiolo. Beautiful nose and Ruby color. The cherry and raspberry flavors pop out. Aroma of rise and anise.

Brought by the Wine Ranger as a last minute change of heart, and this beauty is a new comer to me. We all agreed it needed a load of air and decanted it two hours prior to drinking. However, that wasnâ€™t even nearly enough, so we triple decanted it in the hope we could save it. Harsh grainy tannins and some alcohol notes that have taken nearly all other tastes prisoner. Some fruit showing, this will be beautiful in 5-10 years. Hold though! Towards the end of the night it shut down completely in the glass..

Ravera is a top site in Barolo's Novello commune. The soils have low fertility, with an iron-rich mix of clay and sand. 2010 is Vajra's first vintage. Vajra bought the plot in 2000, replanted in 2001, and initially used the grapes for Langhe Nebbiolo.

This is a big wine, mineral and metallic. Spice, vanilla, cedar. The palate is austere, more minerality and structure than fruit at the moment. Some red berries, balsamic, tobacco. Youthful, intense and persistent. Needs at least 5 more years in bottle. 4*+.
Barolo night was a nice treat.  Heavy tar, asphalt, cedar oak and cigar box flavours. beautiful Barolo colour and structure.  Expectations were met with this wine.

Deep red. plum and blackberry fill your mouth. Slight oak and cherry in the middle palate.  Tobacco, leather and tar. What a complex wine this is. The finish is long and big.
Medium Ruby.  Pretty cherry, leather and some oak on the nose.  Good acidity with cherry, black tea and a hint of cinnamon on the finish. Start drinking now. 2014 in 2021.

Drink now or age for 3 to 4 more years. Interested in trying more stuff from ravera. The tannin and acidity is still quite high for â€˜14 vintage. Definetely doesnâ€™t slow build like other Barolo. Is very subtle and then punches. Nose quite mineral and soft. Palate is leather a bit of tar and then raspberry, black plum and red cherry. Not getting that classic tobacc that I love or dusty tannin in Barolo. More austere but interesting, not meaty but still powerful. Really complements heavier red-sauce dishes

Despite its youth,the floral and red fruit nose underpinned with earthy notes is enthralling and promising.The palate is initially delicate - red currant, cherry and tobacco.Medium bodied with secondary notes of forest floor and hint of leather. Some grippy tannins on the medium-long, drying finish suggest that this is a work in progress that will reward patience. One to buy and lay down - I reckon another 8 to ten years and this wine will be fully integrated and balanced with tertiary notes to relish. Mmmm
Excellent Barolo...tanins under control. Elegant wine
3.7 Deep Garnet in color. Soft, refreshing nose of raspberry and vanilla with a light touch of oak and dried herbs. Cherry and black licorice on the palate followed by gritty tannins.

I donâ€™t get the attraction to Barolo. After a string of iconic MR reds we had this. Was extremely delicate. Like a watered down NZ pinot. Strawberryâ€™s and cherry nuances. But not much more than that and a gentle mouth drying sensation. Similar to most Baroloâ€™s Iâ€™ve tried. IMO Italian reds are either extremely subtle and uninteresting or ball-busting 16%+ amorone style borderline ports. Similar views expressed by others in the tasting group, except for the guy who brought the Barolo who seemed to enjoy it.

Cherry, leather and Aniseed and a little bit of smoke in the nose. Nice acidity that starts strong but then drops away to let the tannin carry through. Medium finish that doesnâ€™t develop much at this stage.

Happy Nebbiolo Monday! This is a delicious wine. Garnet red body with orange tinged rim. Dry herbs and spice with red fruit on the nose. Dried cranberry-cherry, piney black tea and a wisp of smoke. Well blended tannins and acidity for a mineral rock finish with a touch of fruit coming back. Very nice wine 4.3 for me!

Can't wait to keep it longer, me and Barolo problems. Huge tannins and medium acidity,a decanter would help sort this out! Nose is filled with stewed fruits, cherries and rose petals while palate got fruity, jammy notes which pretty much sums up this as a textbook Barolo!

Barolobrunello, second wine was this single wineyard barolo Ravera 12'. Similar notes like on the previous wine except that this one was more closed and spicy. 
Medium ruby colour. 
Sharp metal mineral, minty nose, splashed with fresh cherry and blueberry jam perfumes. 
On palate, fresh with high acidity, medium+ body and big tannins. Not that elegant like previous wine but not far away. Similar flavor, sweet spicy, berry fruity aromas. Finish is long and fruity. It needs a lot of cellaring.

My first Barolo from G.D. Vajra is this young Ravera 2012. It boasts a very juicy berry fruit that mingles with wild flowers, rose petals, spices, camphor, and a bit of ash and rust on the intense and mineral finish. The structure is potent almost muscular by way of a brilliant acidity and grippy tannins. With aeration it gains complexity but more will definitely develop during further cellaring. In summary, a great glass of virile Barolo in a fresh and cool style. Ravera is an MGA in Novello.

Renowned Barolo from a great year. Single vineyard and aged for 32 months in Slavonian oak. The aroma rises like steam to envelope you. The pallet builds slowly but inexorably towards an overwhelming climax of dark berries, tobacco, and mushrooms. A complex profile of spices both autumnal and oriental lurks close by. The style is modern and thus more fruit focused, but the aggressive tannins still make their presence felt.

Clos de lâ€™Oratoire's vineyards are in a cooler area on softer less packed limestone with some sand adding to the aromatics and a bit of clay adding weight. Typically for Comtes von Neipperg there is generous oak and a general sense of just-contained decadence. It has a gorgeous aroma, black plum, rose, nutty richness, leather. A touch of cassis, and 10% Cab Franc adds a leafy edge to the Merlot. The palate is soft, spicy, with tangy raspberry acidity. 5* nose 4* palate. Excellent, performs above its price.

92 pts. Garnet red with Violet reflexes. Compote and ripe fruits first flashes of aging flavors very round and soft tannins with a long finish.
Such a stellar vintage and Estate. Medium body with linear tannin structure.  Perfume bouquet of rose petals, crushed granite and cassis.  Amazing ğŸ‘
2005 in 2022. Nose: ripe plum, full. Palate: fresh acid.  Still fruit forward. Had it at the Toronto Vintnerâ€™s Club Bordeaux event. It ranked 4/8
A sensational and elegant product. Coats the tongue and palate without any shyness whatsoever. Deep, dark fruit with a hint of coffee and tar. Fantastic.
TrÃ¨s beau Ã©quilibre entre charpente et fruits,  de la longueur en bouche pour un grand St emilion
TrÃ¨s bon, a maturitÃ© superbe sur un boeuf mode
Got this bottle as part of a set of futures years ago and while it's 11 years old it is still young. Once it sat for a few minutes it was extraordinary. Lush soft and silky with blackberry fruit.
Wow! Close to a perfect Bordeaux. Dark and starting to brown. Youthful cordial-like aroma. Fruits almost sweet, but balanced acidity delivers a luscious flavour and mouth-feel.
Very aromatic and smooth, very St. Emilion, red fruit, a hint of earth, delicate tannins just to give it enough grip, nice long finish

Beautiful wine with a lot of fruit. Still very young and could age for years. 
New oak, red fruit and very smooth. Brilliant stuff
Part of a vertical (alongside 2010 and 2003). Classic Claret pencil shavings. Mellow tannins. Drinking well but will go for longer.

Clear, medium ruby with modest bricking at rim.

Beautiful, complex and harmonious aromas jump from the glass. Rich core of black plum and blackberry are met with intense melted milk chocolate and fruitcake.

Very nice on the palate. Silky tannins still show presence. Persistent acidity and well-integrated alcohol.

Flavours are well-matched to the nose with plum and chocolate dominant.

Excellent length, great wine.

In a good spot but not at peak.

Drink to 2027.

Absolutely stunning at 15 years of age!
The bouquet of tertiary aromas right off the freshly opened bottle is already breathtaking and it keeps opening up and just lingers on and on in the aftertaste.
Mature Merlot can be so special and outside of Bordeaux and Tuscany I would not know where to look for it?

2005 Bordeaux tasting. All wines tasted blind. 4.5. Much darker and deeper on the nose and palate. Black plum, black cherry, damp earth, forest floor, espresso. Riper then the Gavin and showing a little more youthful. On the palate the tannins are bold but very smooth and the acidity is perfectly integrated. More cocoa and rounded dark fruit notes on the palate. Amazing length and balance despite its ripeness.

Great 2003 from Saint Emilion, seems to me that this bottle had an accelerated maturation as it was at its peak. Very rustic and earthy. A touch of brown, nose of tobacco, coffee, leather, plums, cherries, currents, and spices , full body, rustic with well integrated tannins and lovely supportive acidity, especially given this warm vintage, lovely finish. More robust than elegant. My score 88, drink to 2019

Gorgeous French SE Grand Cru wine that I chose to celebrate my wifeâ€™s entry into her masterâ€™s course at SÃ£o Paulo University, RibeirÃ£o Preto campus. 17 yearâ€™s old wine presenting aged red color with brown reflexes. Superb nose with blackberries, plum and cherry wrapped in florestâ€™s arome notes as wild wood, wet soil and mushrooms. In mouth, ellegant, rounded up, good body and acidity, delivering outstanding flavors honoring nose, adding pleasant subtile tobacco notes & delicious lingering finish. Cheers!
94 deep nose of black forest fruits and pepper. Wonderful layers of smell. Medium bodied and super long finish.RP 94, WS 93
Classy with long finish. Elegant right from the start. Would only get better with age. I only wish I have another bottle in my collection.
Very good good proportions 5.5
Nice Bordeaux but I felt lack of a little bit of power this time.
Really loved this. Bought it for circa Â£80 at the little wine shop off TCR
Very delightful for the price
Properly aged and subtle.
Classy classic Bordeaux. Red fruits and rounded.
A beautiful blend with great depth, complexity and summer fruits.
Delicious and smooth
A classic smooth St Emilion. Â£77 at home. Great but not amazing.
Drinking beautifully - leather, black fruits, sandalwood, forest floor. Stunning.
Soft, silky blackberry with leather on the finish. Soft tannins
In great form

Jammy black fruit, chocolate, and violets on the nose. On the palate, jammy fruit, menthol, with bit of spice and minerality lots of acidity. The midpalate is very round and the rich tannins dance on the palate.

Bordeaux: an assessment of the wines of 2014, 2015 & 2016 from Cru ClassÃ©s & their associated properties. 36/56. A beautiful and good value GCC, 90/10 Merlot/CF. Barrel sample.

Med ruby. Very stylish, plush & ripe w. elegant soft red cherry, blackberry, damson, plum & black cherry. Fleshy & powerful. Gorgeous pronounced aroma intensity w. youthful creamy vanilla.

Dry. M+ silky tannins, m+ acid, ripe & generous w. plum, black & red cherry, blueberry, blackberry, vanilla oak & earthy spice. Long & classy.

This Blanc from Neipperg is a rich, golden, toasty, hedonistic wine.

As it moves through the palate itâ€™s laced with smoke or incense sticks and toast, while the fruit core expands into marmalade and acacia honey, and the wine grows unctuous and creamy.
There is also an aftertaste of honey in the finish and a rush of tropical fruits.
Nose opens full of flavours, very fruity, ripe cherry's, some hints of tabocco. Closing it's top. Full body and complex.  Great!
Enjoyed with Jane Willacy, Nick Black, Alex King and more. Stunning white truffle and plum nose with real focus. Palate is broad yet feminine with a charming lightness of touch. A great value buy
Garnet in colour. Ripe fruit, blackberries, a touch of strawberries, dark chocolate, candied fruit, vanilla and lavender. Smooth, velvety and perfectly balanced.

But let me tell you... will improve lots in next years, this is a beautifull vintage, I prefer even face to 2005. But I couldnot resist... I know nothing about tomorrow but today I m here with this beauty and that s what makes sense to me.

Full bodied red, deep purple in color; nose filled with cedar box, leather, dark currants; rhubarb interwoven raisins and dark currants,  solid 4 stars; would pair with red meats not pastas with white sauce

Very fragrant and spicy nose. Christmas fruitcake blackberry fig. Oak and black fruit hand in hand with chocolate vanilla some leather spice minerality. Pulled out from the cellar and really great to have this bottle.

4.2 - Deep ruby with aromas of forest floor, ripe red and dark fruit, licorice, cedar and oak. Bold and elegant on the palate with soft yet chalky tannins. Blackberry, dark cherry, black currant, leather and hints of tobacco. The wine is still young and Iâ€™m excited to try it again in a few years.

Purple yellow in color, in the nose leather, wet leaves and a touch of sour cherry, on the palate a more present touch of tobacco, spices and oak. For sure still young and I drink now but already very nice

Superb wine! Nose is somewhat spicy with a bit of fruit, ruby colour and a nice full body. Immediate notes of cloves, developing into blackberry and plum, with some earthy undertones too. Clear deep ruby w/ discernible legs.  Mediun plus developing nose of leather, earth, tea and red cherry fruit.  Dry with refreshing medium + acidity that balances out the medium smooth tannins.  Soft wine in the mouth with medium + body medium + intensity and a beautiful ling finish.  Medium + alcohol that is nice and warming at 13.5%

4.3 Beautiful ruby wine with medium legs. Gorgeous black fruit, leather and earth in the ğŸ‘ƒ. Nice dance of red fruit, black fruit, earth and dust in the mouth. What stood out to me was the fruit and minerality. Long smooth finish of earth and fruit. Enjoyed with good friends and Raclette.

While still young, this Bordeaux made my top 5 of the Burgers & Bordeaux wine sampling.  I liked the slightly smoke undertones. WoW! Without a doubt the best 2012 I ever drank. Impressive stuff by Von Neipperg at this rather under-the-radar estate in St-Emilion. 
This Merlot (90%) dominated blend, with very low yields (25hl/Ha), offers ripe notes of cassis, plums, burned coffee, licorice, potpourri, sage and cinnamon. 
Full-bodied and perfectly balanced with sweet, juicy blueberries, plums and herbs on the silky, smooth palate. Great tension, concentration and depth with soft tannins in the long finish. Impressive red! Value!!! 4,4

Appearance: ruby red, medium intens, clear. 
Nose: developing, clean condition, medium (+) intens.  Aromas of cherry, plum,  slight vegetal touch, slight floral hints, liquorice. 
Palate: dry,clean condition, medium (+) intens,  medium (+) acidity, medium (+) body, medium (+) finish, medium (+) tannins. 
Assessment: outstanding wine.  Potential for aging.  80% Merlot,  20% Cabarnet Franc.

Exotic, full- bodied, fleshy and sumptuous, this hedonistic blend of 90% Merlot and10% Cabernet Franc was created by Stephan von Neippberg.
Delivering an aromatic display of cedar wood, chocolate fudge ice cream sundae, cassis, roasted espresso, spice box and scorched earth flavors.
Ripe, well - integrated , velvety tannins and full - body in a sexy , luscious style!

Sweet plums, cherry, wood, flowers, forest floor/earth, wood and herbs. Very good!

Soft and well balanced St Emilion with notes of strawberry jam, ripe black fruits and some vanilla.  Tannins are well integrated and the wine has a good freshness.  Not bad at all, but it lacks some power and depth to be great.

Ordered from and decanted at restaurant. Dark red color. Barnyardish nose. Full bodied. Black fruits and an exotic touch of incense. Luscious yet good balance. I wouldnt say it lacks a structure especially with that bit of bite that kicks in at the finish but it does lack some vibrancy? One may want to give it more time to air before dinner but I suspect while drinking well now this may be quite close to its peak and unlikely to improve much.

Flight 1 of our Huntsworth wine, wine tasting vs Alion 2012. Pale red color.  Very fruity nose. Velvety and silky tannins mix of red and black berries. Crowd pleaser. Excellent at this price point. Trounced the Alion by a good margin...

Big,brash and still young, but drinking superbly after a 2hr decant.
Fleshy, youthful, dark fruit, plums, berries, with some hints of earth, spice and a solid dose of oak.
The tannins need to resolve, but theyâ€™re not harsh or offensive, more rich and chewy. This is still ascending but should hit its peak in the next 5 years.
Delicious

Located on a north-east slope, the 10.32 hectares grow on Fronsac molasse covering a layer of sand with a clay subsoil. Deep Ruby with aromas of dark berries and floral notes. A blend of 90% Merlot & 10% Cab Franc, aged in 45% new oak. On the palate black cherry and strawberry flavors with notes of cacao, licorice and smoke. Fine grainy tannins, medium+ finish, ending with subtle oak character. Tasting Sample.

Very solid, with a dark black fruit profile of currant, blackberry and fig framed by roasted alder wood and backed by bittersweet ganache and mouthwatering briar notes on the long finish. This has the tarry grip of the vintage and there's lively acidity behind all the fruit and grip. Drink now.

Sample exchange with @[1|3424099|Tom De Vos] with another Saint-Emilion, a GCC now ğŸ˜€. The nose is loaded with cassis & blackcurrants! Further we have a nice coffee spot, lots of cedar, graphite and something that reminds me of clay and some herbal undertones with eucalyptus whiff and sous bois. Silky smooth on the palate with a good balance between ripe fruit and acidity taking you to a long silky & smooth finish with sweet spot of cassis and caramel macchiato coffee. Lovely 4.0ğŸ‘Œ

I mean... I mean... Sometimes you are poured a glass of wine that you could just smell all night long and drink sparingly so that you can keep doing it? 0.5 stars for quality of nose alone. On the palette, terrific black fruit, smooth, and amazing

Like most wines from the 2006 St. Emilion this is now ready to drink. Classical Bordeaux, with black fruit, liquorace and cigare on the palate. Smooth, velvety tannins. The finish is a bit on the dry side. Best with food. It will last for many more years.

This takes the power of the vintage and puts it in its pocket for later, preferring instead to let mouthwatering briar, loganberry, mulberry and blackberry fruit strut its way forward, enlivened with roasted wood spice and supported by suavely but thoroughly embedded iron-tinged structure. Should cruise for two decades. Best from 2016 through 2035. â€“James Molesworth

Buttery and smooth.

This has aged nicely into an assertive-but-softened wine. Beautiful deep color still, and muted spiciness of herbal stems and twigs; a background of deep black plums and skins, and a light bitterness of charcoal embers.

Thereâ€™s barnyard on the nose (hay, horses!), black cherry sauce / Black Forest gateaux, cedar, graphite, and blackcurrant. In the mouth, the fruit may have faded with age, but thereâ€™s still enough left to enjoy. Thereâ€™s some sharp red fruit, with red cherry and strawberry most apparent, a hint of bubble gum, some blackcurrant, old leather, chocolate, and obvious old oak into the charcoal smoke finish. You seem to spot something new with every sip which is the sign of a decent wine.

Red fruit, raspberries and blueberry, with mushroom and a touch of barnyard. Nice balance. Very enjoyable, but it doesnâ€™t make sense to cellar these any longer.

TrÃ¨s beau reprÃ©sentant de St Emilion dans un millÃ©sime pas forcÃ©ment rÃ©putÃ©. 
A maturitÃ©, il offre des effluves de fruits noirs lÃ©gÃ¨rement compotÃ©s, du tabac et du cacao. 
Du velours en bouche, gourmand et de bonne longueur. 
Jamais dÃ©Ã§u par ce chÃ¢teau.
Beautiful fruit.  So easy to drink and get lost in.  Not sure what else you could ask for, or expect, at this price point.  Highly recommended.

A little shy of 4ğŸŒŸ.  It is almost there already. The only draw back was the finishing and body. Medium-full bodied which I would prefer and expert it to be more full. Clove, dark fruit, plum. Oaky, earthy, fine tannin. Well, still a good wine to me.

Softness x 200 %. Delicious wine. Balanced. Very suitable to comfort you during the hard winter months. But like most of Bordeaux not worth the price point. At 20-25EUR this would be a wine I would buy constantly - give me 12 straight away. But at the current price point.....not so much.

Not as fruity as Iâ€™d expect from a St. Emilio. Moderate ruby core with a reddish-garnet rim. The bouquet is developing nicely with licorice, truffle and black pepper notes along with some ripe strawberry and blueberry. Dry with medium-plus acidity and medium tannin. Thereâ€™s a strong oak influence; smokiness and cedar at the forefront along with flavors of smoked red meat. Itâ€™s got a full body and lasting finish. Aging nicely and will continue to do so for another 15 years.

Medium ruby in appearance.
Baked black fruit and red fruit on the nose. Toast, nutmeg and earthy notes at the back.

Dry, medium acidity, prominent tannin, high alcohol and medium body. Medium finish. 

The wine is very good. Itâ€™s ready to drink now and can age further for more complexity.

Hearty, dark, somewhat tart on the palate, plum jam, herbs, balsamic notes.  Overall, however, terrific.  2nd place out of 18 in blind tasting (blind tasting top merlots worldwide)

Kernig, dunkel, etwas herb am Gaumen, Pflaumenmus, KrÃ¤uter, balsamische Noten. Insgesamt aber grandios. Platz 2 von 18 im Blind Tasting (Blind-Tasting Top-Merlots weltweit)

Une puissance qui pourrait rappeler un bon Pecharmant et des notes trÃ¨s marquÃ©es de fruits noirs confits notamment sur la cerise griotte avec un parfum de liqueur, les tanins sont exceptionnels et la longueur excellente

Little hot on nose at first, probably due to youth. Nice dark red color like dark cherry. Vegetal green pepper and plum on nose. Cigar and tart cherry on palate. Not a lingering finish but pleasant none the less.

Wine is clear, brightness is day bright, deep dark ruby, edge is deep pink, no gas, no sediment, viscosity moderate. 
Aroma is clean, black current, black cherry, dried black plum, black pepper aroma.
Dry, medium body, medium + acidity, medium + tannin, medium alcohol, finish is moderate.

Medium garnet yellowish rim. Nose of ripe blackberry, dried prune and raspberry, sweet spices, tar, leather. Medium body, more simple in mouth but good precision, more earthy with autumn leave note, fair concentration and a bit short. Aged well. Delicious though. Drink up.

4.2 - Happy Bordeaux Sunday folks! How great is it that we have tomorrow off as well? Following Neippergâ€™s stellar Castillon bottling, I had to try the St. Emilion. Honestlyâ€”I think I prefer the Castillon but itâ€™s a close race! Deep ruby in glass with brooding notes of blackberry, cassis, prune, fig, pencil shavings, toasty cedar and subtle menthol. Medium+ body with moderate balanced acidity and tons of grippy tannins. Still beautiful but not as warm or approachable as the Castillon.

Excellent Saint-Emilion Grand Cru ClassÃ©.
Very expressive nose dominated by raspberries, blackberries, strawberries, vanilla, cedar wood and gingerbread. 
On the palate the same flavours return, with powerful but already softened tannins, good structure and perfectly balanced acidity. The finale is not incredibly complex, but well crafted and long-lasting.
Definitely worth the money.

A quite big and dense 2010  blend of 90% Merlot and 10% Cab Franc! Still a very present acidity and chewy tannins! It needs to age cause itâ€™s a baby! 4â­ï¸! On the palate are flavours of blackberries, licorice, coffee, tar and some thyme. A long and medium coating finish! Cheers ğŸ·

Coravin tasting
develops nicely in the glass along the first hour
med+ aromas intensity of a good+ Saint Emilion Grand Cru ClassÃ©e, red forest fruit, oak-vanilla, forest floor
developing
dry, high acidity, high tannins, med abv, med body, basic complexity, med length aftertaste, med+ flavors intensity consistent with the aromas of a solid wine, not an excellent Saint Emilion Grand Cru ClassÃ©e, required further aging of another 5 years or more
90

I bought this wine in 2015 after trying in St Emillion on a beautiful summers day. Now was the real test to see if this was a summer romance or a great wine!

Decanted for 90 minutes before drinking however this was filling the room even after a matter of minutes with lots of dark fruit, liquorice and forrest floor aromas.

A beautifully balanced, medium bodied wine with soft blackberry and black cherry fruit on the palate. Soft, ripe tannins on the finish. Drinking perfectly now.

Yup , open up last night , I often find some of these more complex Bordeauxâ€™s soften , alcohol gone , fruit flavors mature , mineral earthy tones advancedâ€¦ lovely mature fruit, soft lush tannins, blackberry jam, stone mineral flavors, dark oaky aspectsâ€¦ complex flavorsâ€¦
Black fruit, a slight bitterness and a round body. Great Staint-Ã‰milion with huge aging potential.

Deep ruby red colour with slight vegetals on the nose initially, baked cherry & licorice on the nose. Full bodied with med + acidity & med + tannins. Blackberries, black cherry with licorice on the palate. Good but will benefits from more cellaring time :)

STARS OF RIGHT BANK 2012

These are my brief report on the Bordeaux 2012 vintages that I tasted. Top 3 of my favorites are:
1. La Conseillante
2. Beauregard
3. Canon la Gaffelier

This wine exhibits an overload of vanilla, woodiness and bitterness on the nose. Not surprisingly, the palette is overwhelmed by vanilla, however, loads of good fruits are masked behind the oak, I think it'll take many years to reach some harmony of balance of fruits and oak.

dark ruby red, blend of 90% Merlot and 10% Cab Franc. Intense nose with ripe black plums. Juicy palate, plums follow through on the palate with slightly chewy tannins. Would recommend to enjoy with a steak to carry the otherwise chewy tannins. Keep for another 3-4yrs.

Made with 90% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc, deep burgundy color, definitely an early drinking candidate, nose smells of menthol, black plum, cassis, charcoal, clay, eucalyptus, soy sauce, licorice, clove, and cigar box, full body with balanced acidity and refined tannin, tastes of cassis, blackcurrant, blueberry, tobacco, dark chocolate, licorice and hazelnut, very smooth and soothing, lacking some distinctive character but a tasty wine nevertheless.

Great for a Monday Merlot fix. 90% merlot, 10% Cab Franc.
Pretty standard dark ruby Bordeaux color.
Nose offers dark berries and earthy aromas. 
On the palate much more of a red fruit than black,  red cherry, dense raspberry, some plum, and graphite supported by a solid oak structure.
Pretty chewy tannins in the long finish.

Deep ruby with purple hue.    Mediam plus intensity on the nose, notes of mocha dominates upfront, follow by cigar box, eucalytus, blackberries, and spices.  Hints of violets.  Elegant palate, velvety, well-rounded without an overbearly weight (very merlot dominant).  Relatively balanced, integrated tannins and alcohol, need time for it to fully open to enjoy the full dynamic characteristics.

(4.1) An aroma of leather, earth, red berries, and a hint of vanilla. Between a dark and bright red in color. Black cherry and hint of strawberries and spice on the palate. Soft, velvety and round mouth feel with good tannins. Smooth and well balanced, maybe even better in a year or two. Itâ€™s a dry wine with a medium long finish.

Velvety, Oaky, berry, fishy(roasted salmon skin?), truffle aroma some sage and pine. Smell reminds me of Vieux Donjon. Light body and mouthfeel. Juicy. Sour at the back of the tongue. Pretty grippy. Better to smell than drink.

MV TB, Wed soirÃ©e, 5.1.22.

So plush, intense, forward aromas, dark plum, chocomocha creaminess, different from the Italian Bdx-blend. 

Mouthfeel was full, creamy lush texture, very supple but nicely integrated but plush body. Expressive,fresh focused acidity, muscular chewiness. Long sl sour finale of smoke, freshcut oak, but dry. 

Decided it's Merlot dominant RB Bdx, likely a good vintage SE, 6-10yr. Yes, lovely voluptuous Saint-Emilion. 

4.0â˜†Haven't had this appellation before, very good! M90 CF10

4.35 right bank at its best, ofcourse in medium budget. 35 euro in leclerc warsaw few years ago was a bargain. In nose raspberry and figs. A lot of figs. Then some oak and blackberries on a paleate. Still clearly feel figs. Complex and ready to drink. Beautiful merlot ! Recomend.

Second bottle opened 2022. Still young, but now a solid 4.0; latex has turned into dried leaves. Tannins have integrated better. Additional cocoa and chocolate on the finish. Still better with a hard decanting. Could use several more years in bottle. 

3.75. Opened 2020. Still young. Fruit, capsicum, hints of tobacco and latex on the nose. Light Cherry, plum, blueberry, flint palate. Light acids and chalky tannins. Needs decanting to open.

Deep purple color. On the nose this wine really attracts me, elegant dark red fruits, plum, elegant, cool, smooth. On the palate the first impression from the nose goes on. There is more, complexity, elegance, fine grained tannins, herbs and a med to long finish.

First day: blackberry, barnyard and chocolate. On the palate light but nice texture. Medium length. 90 GP
Day two: wild berries, blackberries and strawberries. No barnyard anymore. Very fresh fruit here, sexy and sweet with just a hint of vanilla. On the palate nice blackberries with dark chocolate. Quite low acidity but not sweet or sticky. Medium length of a very nice Merlot. 92 GP

Pop and drink St Emilion... my last of perhaps 4 bottles I had, running down my St Emilions and moving to Pauillacs and Pomerols, and especially Margauxs and Pessac-Leognans! Not the most complex black fruits bottle, but easy drinking with smooth tannins which developed over the 2 hour dinner at Uncle Hos Butchers Table, my sharing with @[1|24439245|Joe Yee Wong] and @[1|9482449|Mika Tyson Teau]. Decanted for 2+ hours. This is still quite close and would benefit from another 3-5 years in the cellar. Very pleased with the freshness of this right bank, with red fruit and herbal notes perfectly complementing the mid acidity. It kind of feels like it hasn't reached its full body just yet. I could not detect any developed tertiary flavours, and the lingering finish does not quite deliver the expected complexity.

3.8pts 

This started a bit lay back, although did not decant but airing in glass over 2 hrs gives a much integration of its black fruits , mainly blueberry , plum & touch of tobacco & dried sandalwood. 

Palate is easy drinking, blueberry & plum , later some herbaceous. Gd lifted structure and medium body with gd finished .

Clear but deep ruby.  Pronounced nose, very open, fresh Alpine pine, abundant ripe blackberry and plum, new oak - lovely aroma!  Medium to M+ acidity, soft and round medium tannin, M+ body.  M+ finish, overwhelming fruitiness, brambles, cassi, blackberry and plum, well integrated.  Drinking very well now, can age further.  1 November 2021.

Oak and licorice nose aromas, with mild acidicness. A deep red color.

A balanced wine. Delicious plum, black cherry, licorice and oak notes. A dry, lengthly, oaky and tasty finish. Vintage: 2012. Varietal: 90% Merlot, 5% cabernet franc, 5% cabernet sauvignon. ABV: 13.5%. My 8th wine of 10 french wines in a row. Still have a 2010, and 2012 in the cellar, will revisit. I Recommend this wine.

Medium aromas, medium+ palate intensity. Blackcurrant, fig, dried blueberry, blackberry, white pepper, leather, dried cherry.
Very Dry with medium+ body, medium acidity, medium+ tannins, and medium finish. Deep purple color.

A typical Saint Emilion style with Cabernet Franc and Merlot grapes. Fruity, sweet and soft.  Aromas include blackberry, cream, vanilla,  oak, and  chocolate.  Acidity and tannin are moderate.  Easy to drink. Lack of complexity and finished short.  Still enjoyable.  Opened bottle on 4/28/2021.

Rich, lush taste or dark fruits and plums. The oak is already well integrated and unnoticeable. It is full bodied and already showing hints of secondary notes of tobacco. This one will continue to develop for many years in the cellar, but was already now a perfect match to a rib-eye steak from the grill.

90% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Franc; 17m in oak. 

Deep ruby red.

Blackcurrant, bacon, gravel in nose.

In mouth, when chilled, coating tannins are so soft and silky. Long fruity finish. 

When warms up, tannins get a bit rougher, as well as acidity becomes a bit higher than you'd want it to be. So it feels like this wine needs a few more years to fully integrate tannins and come into full balance.

Pleasurable wine with a gentle, feminine character.

4.2, assuming potential for further improvement.

Might have drank this too young. Red and black fruits, earth and spice. Kinda tight in the palate with bright fruit. Elegant fruits and a little lighter weight on the palate than o expected. Short, fruity finish.

Deep ruby red. This is still very fresh. Notes of fresh red cherries, some mint, fresh oak. Nose is of medium intensity. Medium bodied. Fine velvety tannins. Medium length finish. Not bad and balanced but feels average.

Klart en madvin som har godt af noget fedt til at stÃ¥ op mod syren.

Rosso granato intenso. Naso molto complesso con note terrestri (humus, macchia) e speziate (cannella, chiodo di garofano, pepe nero) in evidenza, sotto si avvertono sentori fruttati (prugna, marmellata di more) e balsamici (eucalipto, mentuccia). Bocca con grande concentrazione e tessitura, buona lunghezza, morbido davanti, continua spesso, finale strutturato e dolce, tannino ancora vivo....ecco la meraviglia di Bordeaux...21 anni e non sentirli...
